channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#1327; 06:41PM; 821 N Spring St; MAP: https://bit.ly/4aG5SHm; #Chinatown; 49 LAFD Firefighters took just 41 minutes (7:22 PM) to search for, access, confine and fully extinguish a small but stubborn fire, held in check by fire sprinklers, within one second-floor (retail clothing) business in a large two-story row of commercial occupancies. During fire attack, one adult male civilian was found within/near the premises suffering from apparent smoke inhalation. He is currently being questioned by LAPD (Central Division Incident #3529) and LAFD Investigators to determine his relationship with the fire, as he is prepared for ambulance transport to an area hospital. No other injuries reported. The cause of the fire is under active LAFD investigation. ; FS 4; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 1; AR1 BC1 BC11 CM20 CM22 E201 E203 E3 E4 E9 RA1 RA4 RA804 SQ21 T1 T3 T9; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Update Structure Fire; INC#0838; 04:45PM; 19817 W Hatton St; MAP: https://bit.ly/41KQo0v; #Winnetka; A functional smoke alarm in the 2,159 square foot two-story residence reportedly aided the adult male homeowner (and sole building occupant) in safely escaping the fast-moving fire. His further statement to firefighters indicate a natural Christmas Tree in the first floor living room area to be the origin of the fire that destroyed his home. A City of Los Angeles Department of Building & Safety Inspector has formally "Red Tagged" the heavily damaged and physically unstable structure as unfit for entry. The LAFD was pleased to coordinate initial basic monetary assistance for the homeowner through the California Fire Foundation's 'Supplying Aid to Victims of Emergency' (SAVE) Program ( https://www.cafirefoundation.org/what-we-do/for-communities/save ), and made the homeowner aware of available community resources.; FS 104; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC10 BC15 BC17 CM40 CM42 E104 E105 E290 E293 E305 E72 E87 EA1 EM15 PI2 RA104 RA107 RA72 SO1 T105 T90 T93; CH8; 17 18; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#0838; 02:18PM; 19817 W Hatton St; MAP: https://bit.ly/41KQo0v; #Winnetka; 54 LAFD Firefighters took just 53 minutes to access, confine and extinguish heavy fire on both floors of a 2,159 square foot two-story home (built 1986), that was well involved on their arrival. Firefighters skillfully prevented flames from damaging the two story residence to the east. The adult male (and sole) occupant of the burning home at the time of the fire, exited the premises safely prior to LAFD arrival. No injuries have been reported. Fire cause remains under investigation.; FS 104; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC10 BC15 BC17 CM40 CM42 E104 E105 E290 E293 E305 E72 E87 EM15 PI2 RA104 RA107 RA72 SO1 T105 T90 T93; CH9; 17 18; Brian Humphrey

Update Structure Fire; INC#0838; 01:25PM; 19817 W Hatton St; MAP: https://bit.ly/41KQo0v; #Winnetka; The 33 assigned LAFD Firefighters are continuing their fire attack in a defensive posture, protecting a two story residence to the east, as they prepare to transition to offensive operations against still heavy fire on both floors of a 2,159 square foot two-story home (built 1986), that was well involved on their arrival. All occupants of the home exited the premises safely prior to LAFD arrival.; FS 104; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC15 BC17 E104 E105 E293 E305 E72 RA104 RA72 SO1 T105 T93; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0838; 01:25PM; 19817 W Hatton St; MAP: https://bit.ly/41KQo0v; #Winnetka; PRELIM: Offensive Fire Attack on Two-Story Home Well Involved With Fire.; FS 104; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC15 BC17 E104 E105 E293 E305 E72 RA104 RA72 T105 T93; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

Fatality Traffic Collision; INC#0342; 07:13AM; 8900 N Winnetka Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/48v7vWn; #Winnetka; PRELIM: Three vehicle collision. Three patients total: One adult male is deceased and remains at scene. Two other adults (undetermined gender), have been taken to an area hospital by LAFD Paramedics in serious but stable condition. #LATraffic: Closure of one or more lanes of travel in the vicinity of Winnetka Avenue near Nordhoff Street until LAPD / Medical Examiner operations are complete, unknown duration. Motorists, expect congestion and delay, avoid the immediate area and consider an alternate route. Detours are readily available. Transit Users: Follow @MetroLAAlerts on Twitter/X ( https://twitter.com/MetroLAAlerts) for any service updates. Media Inquiries: LAPD Valley Traffic Division (Incident #898) and Medical Examiner. ; FS 104; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC17 E103 E104 EM15 RA104 RA107 RA896; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire - FATALITY; INC#0218; 05:13AM; 756 South Boyle Avenue; MAP: https://bit.ly/3vicZ8H; Boyle Heights; There were a total of five occupants in the home. Two patients were pulled out of the fire and transported in critical condition. A third patient was located outside the structure, on the porch, sadly beyond medical help and determined deceased on scene. The two occupants who were out of the home upon LAFD arrival are being evaluated for any possible injuries. Ages/genders unknown at this time. LAFD PIO Captain Adam VanGerpen is enroute for media availability. No further details.; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; AR1 BC1 BC11 BC2 BC5 CM20 CM22 E2 E201 E202 E203 E210 E287 E3 E4 E447 E458 E9 EA1 EM1 HR3 RA17 RA2 RA25 RA3 RA4 RA803 SQ21 SQ87 T1 T10 T2 T3 T87 T9 UR3 UR88; CH7; 13 14; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0218; 04:49AM; 756 South Boyle Avenue; MAP: https://bit.ly/3vicZ8H; Boyle Heights; KNOCKDOWN: 54 firefighters extinguished the fire in 25 minutes with no damage to the exposures. While conducting a search of the building, firefighters located a victim and pulled them out in critical condition. A thorough secondary search was clear with no other occupants located. LAFD Arson is responding for the investigation per protocol. No further details. ; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 BC2 BC5 CM20 CM22 E2 E201 E202 E203 E210 E287 E3 E4 E447 E458 E9 EM1 HR3 RA17 RA2 RA25 RA3 RA4 RA803 SQ21 SQ87 T1 T10 T2 T3 T87 T9 UR3 UR88; CH9; 13 14; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#0218; 04:24AM; 756 South Boyle Avenue; MAP: https://bit.ly/3vicZ8H; Boyle Heights; One story, single family dwelling fully involved in fire. Two additional task forces requested. Firefighters are in the defensive mode while defending the exposed buildings on two sides of the fire unit. ; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 E2 E202 E447 E458 RA17 RA2 RA25 RA4 SQ21 T2 T9; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1259; 05:31PM; 19528 W Leadwell St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3RCbcmj; Reseda; KNOCKDOWN: 30 firefighters extinguished the fire in 18 minutes with no injuries reported. Firefighters contained the fire to one room of one unit in a triplex (updated building type), preventing the fire from extending into the attic. No further details.; FS 73; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC15 BC17 E103 E104 E273 E287 E290 E293 E73 RA100 RA73 T73 T87 T90 T93; CH9; 17; Margaret Stewart
